Posts.Content: Napaoctober wrote: Hi all! I found a lump 6 mos ago, turned out to be simple cyst visualized on ultrasound.  Recently, the area where the cyst was seemed 'thicker' and my Dr felt it too.  She said she couldn't be sure what it was so ordered another diagnostic mammo and u/s.  Had that today and the mammo was normal and was compared to my mammo 6 mos ago and shows no changes and nothing suspicious.  They did an u/s after mammo and it too saw nothing - not even the cyst.  I still feel thicker lumpier area, and the u/s tech did as well.  Could this just be how my breast is now since I'm getting older?  I have had mastitis in this breast on several occasions and have saline implants that are approx 10 yrs old...could it be scar tissue?  The lumpy area is right above my nipple and does swell before my period and seems to go down after although still palpable.  Radiologist said to watch it carefully for change but no need to worry, all tests were negative.  I would not have been concerned in the least about this but then I read some posts on the Not Diagnosed but Worried Board.  There seems to be many people who had normal diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound and then they still find cancer.  Makes me think I should've asked for biopsy!  What would you do? Is it safe to just assume this is the new 'normal for me'?  I have to admit I just started doing regular breast self exams a year ago and that is when I noticed this lumpy area so who knows if it's always been like this. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Had u/s and diagnostic mammo - nothing found?? Napaoctober NJDevChick

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2011 08:05AM - edited Apr 10, 2011 08:05AM by Napaoctober Thanks all.  The area does grow and shrink, but never totally goes away.  The other breast is smooth w/ no lumps.  Is it unusual to have only one 'bad' breast?  In the past year I have seen my gyn who ordered diagnositic mammo and u/s - mammo was negative, u/s showed small cyst.  6 months later, another diagnostic mammo and u/s.  Both were negative (but had it done 10 days after period when they aren't as lumpy/bumpy.)  I'm now a week before my period and the area has grown again and is sore.  I am almost 37 and have noticed a change in my cycle probably due to aging/hormone changes so maybe this is just how my breasts are now.  I will ask gyn about it again when I have my annual exam in 5 mos. Thanks.
Posts.Title: Had u/s and diagnostic mammo - nothing found?? Napaoctober NJDevChick

THey said that if taken more than whats in a daily multi-vit it acts as an ANTI-antioxident.  Thought that was interesting.  I can't give up my morning coffee, but I can work on rest of day and probably cut back on morning coffee as right now I drink 6 cups (way too much!) THX!

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2011 06:23AM Napaoctober wrote: Well, I'm not giving up red wine or coffee any time soon! It is annoying how the studies always change!  Hard to trust any new research!
Posts.Title: Had u/s and diagnostic mammo - nothing found?? Napaoctober NJDevChick

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2011 01:22PM Napaoctober wrote: Thanks dlb823!  My instinct isn't really telling me to push for second opinion. I guess I was just taken aback by reading of all the stories of cancer that was totally undetected by diagnostic mammo and u/s.  I did not know that scenario was so common.  I realize this is a breast cancer forum - so you are bound to hear of some stories like that, but I didn't think it would be so common.  The sonographer was extremely thorough - she must've spent 30 min looking for something.  The thickened area has shrunk a lot since I'm 10 days past my period (it grows before my period) so maybe it's just fibrocystic changes.  My boobs are very small (like a negative A cup) so how hard could it be to miss something?  I've had melanoma in past and don't trust my instincts anymore as one cancer dx tends to make you paranoid!  In the first year following my melanoma diagnosis I was CONVINCED i had other cancers and health issues - all ended up being nothing but paranoia. Thanks for the advice!
Posts.Title: Had u/s and diagnostic mammo - nothing found?? Napaoctober NJDevChick

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2011 04:40AM Napaoctober wrote: Thanks Deanna!  I thought this wouldn't bother me, but I'm not entirely comfortable with my lumpy area.  It is so obviously a lump and so different from my other breast!  I do think it's starting to grow now that I have 'PMS' so maybe this is the new normal for me???? How would I go about sending my u/s mammo results to one of those places?  I have no idea where to start!  Or, should I just call my Doc and have an MRI?  I know she will order an MRI if I ask and my insurance covers it 100%.
Posts.Title: Had u/s and diagnostic mammo - nothing found?? Napaoctober NJDevChick

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2010 01:57PM Napaoctober wrote: I am not a breast cancer survivor, just someone worried/waiting on testing.  I am from USA though.  If I were you, I would call my GYN and have him/her fax a request for a diagnostic mammogram.  No reason to pay office fees for GYN to do a manual exam.  Then based on the mammo results I'd go from there.  Most places you can pick up your written report the next day and then call your gyn to read report and go from there. Best wishes!
Posts.Title: Not sure what to think or do... rollergirl78 Beesie

Posts.Content: May 26, 2017 10:01AM Napaoctober wrote: Update:  I went in for the diagnostic mammogram and was sent back to the waiting area so radiologist could read it.  I was then called into the tech's office and she said that he saw an area of concern that needed a closer look.  So I waited 30 more minutes and had an ultrasound.  Ultrasound showed NORMAL breast tissue!  I have to come back in 1 year.  Thx for the support.  It's funny how we worry for weeks leading up to the apt and then forget about it immediately as soon as we get good results. I wanted to post this for others who may come here concerned about a callback or about a change shown on mammogram when compared to past mammograms.
Posts.Title: Called back for new questionably increased area of denseness Napaoctober MTwoman

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2011 02:42PM Napaoctober wrote: Hi Lanus, I found a lump like you are describing, about 6 mos ago.  It was right above my nipple and felt like a raspberry - that's a great description.  I had a diagnostic mammo and u/s and they said it was cysts - and simple fluid filled and that I didnt need to come back until I was 40 (i was 36).  It's now 6 mos later and I've slacked in doing my breast exams the past few months - had other health issues (orthopedic running injury) that have kept my mind occupied.  I did a breast exam this month and it's larger now and there seems to be more cysts.  I'm seeing my Internal Med Dr tomorrow and hoping to get an MRI or biopsy.  I have implants so MRI might be best for me.  I guess what I'm saying is that if you think it'll weigh heavy on your mind you may just be better off getting rid of it now!  Good luck!
Posts.Title: Lump found, not sure what to expect or do... Lanus Lanus

Posts.Content: Napaoctober wrote: I had a screening mammogram last week and was called yesterday for 'questionably increased right upper parenchymal density'. This new area of denseness wasn't seen on my previous 5 mammograms. I have heterogeneously dense breasts. I also have implants that are under the muscle. That is all the report said. How common is this? I have already had cancer once, melanoma. I am 42 years old. Im trying because not to worry, they can't get me in for the diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound until May 24th, waiting is difficult. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Called back for new questionably increased area of denseness Napaoctober MTwoman

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2011 04:47PM Napaoctober wrote: Thank you for all the responses!  I am a worrier by nature, since my melanoma diagnosis.  Before that I didn't think anything bad would/could happen to me!  The main confusion I have is that I felt 100% secure 6 months ago about these strange lumps in my breast after my diagnositic mammo and ultrasound.  Now I am starting to wonder if I should have felt that secure, after reading some stories online regarding how many cancers are missed.  Makes me wonder why they even do diagnostic mammo and u/s.  Is it pretty common for them to miss something? I mean, doesn't it take yrs for cancer to develop?

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2011 08:14AM Napaoctober wrote: Thanks MomOf3!  I have a lumpy area - not that clearly defined - so it would be hard to remove it all I think.  I'm hopeful it's just fibrocystic changes, but I want to make sure it's not atypical cells or cancer.  I've had mastitis so many times in that breast and I wonder if it's scarred from all that? I think I'll push for a biopsy and take my chances with rupture.  My implants are 10 yrs old and need replaced anyway - so I'm not that worried about it being ruptured.  Then maybe my husband would buy me some new ones! ha ha

I didn't realize they could do a biopsy in an imaging center.  Is it just a needle biopsy?  If it's an 'area' of thickening, how do they do a needle biopsy of that?  How do they know if they got the correct spot?  I have implants too - will they be afraid to do biopsy b/c of that?  I'm hoping these tests don't results in a referral to another Dr and MORE waiting! I've been calling everyday trying to get in on cancellation, so hopefully today will be my lucky day and I'll get in early!  I hate waiting for testing.  It's like a rain cloud following you around! Posts.Title: diagnostic u/s, mammo, and possible biopsy Thursday - questions Napaoctober maddyandzekesmom

Posts.Content: Napaoctober wrote: Hello again, I asked a question approx 6 mos ago about lump in breast.  I received a mammogram which was negative and an ultrasound.  The ultrasound visualized a small cyst, but did not say anything about the other thickened area in my breast.  One of my breasts is fairly smooth with no thickenings or cysts, but the other is very lumpy and has one area right above my nipple that feels thicker and has multiple small bumps in it (smaller than pea).  It feels like a large lumpy bump.  I have noticed that it gets larger before my period and by the end of my period it is smaller, but still there.  The small phase of the lump is now larger than it used to be.  I'll be 37 this summer and am a survivor of melanoma.  I nursed three children for over a year and was constantly getting mastitis.  I think I have had mastitis 8 times or more.  I also have saline under muscle breast implants that I got 10 years ago.  I guess my question is - should I make an appt now or wait for 6 mos until my next annual pap is due to have it checked again?  Would I have had a benign/normal mammogram and ultrasound 6 months ago and this really be something bad?  Can you have fibrocystic breast changes in one breast only?  I never picked up my reports so I have no idea what the BIRADS were or even if I have dense breasts. The report they mailed only said come back in 5 years for mammogram, it had no detail. I know one thing, they are very small and not much breast tissue left at all after nursing - it's hard to believe something could be missed. Thanks for your advice and help! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I'm sorry to bother you all, but this has been worrying me! Napaoctober irish22

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2011 08:52PM - edited Mar 28, 2011 08:39AM by Napaoctober Hi again!  I saw my Dr on Friday and she felt the lumps.  She said there is a nodular area and one distinct lump as well as a lump I didn't even notice on the underside of my breast.  She said it was alarming that the 'cyst' is still there after 6 months.  I thought it was normal for cysts to hang around??  Anyway, she referred me back to the breast center for a diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound (and biopsy if needed.)  What kind of biopsy can they do in a breast imaging center?  Is it safe to do with my saline implants?  My appt is Thursday.  I am hoping to get a biopsy because I want to know what's going on in there!  Waiting for biopsy results has become a part of life since my melanoma diagnosis - it's a pain!  What Type of Biopsy is best?  The area is an area of lumps - not one distinct lump.  Thanks for your time and advice!
Posts.Title: I'm sorry to bother you all, but this has been worrying me! Napaoctober irish22

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2011 09:37PM Napaoctober wrote: I'm sorry you are so stressed!  I have a lump in my right breast that also does not show up on ultrasound or mammo.  I've had two diagnostic mammograms and two ultrasounds in the past year.  One time they saw a cyst, but this time no cyst and they really didn't see anything.  The tech did feel the lump, as did my GYN and PCP.  I have come to the conclusion that this is just normal for me - although I don't like having a weird lump in my breast!  I am 36 so I think things might start to change around this age.  My area also seems to 'flare' when I have PMS so I think it might be fibrocystic breast changes.  I have had cancer before (melanoma) and one thing about cancer is that it grows/changes.  Things that aren't changing usually aren't cancer (because cancer is cells growing out of control).  At least that's true with melanoma. One way to put this all behind you is a biopsy.  Why don't you just call your Doc and ask for one?  I am sure they'd order it.
